title: Guy Nosibor
text:
Guy Nosibor (born 22 July 1954) is a French former professional <a href="Association%20football">football</a> player and manager. As a player, he was a <a href="Forward%20%28association%20football%29">forward</a> and <a href="right%20winger">right winger</a>.
Playing career.
Nosibor was born in <a href="Rivi%C3%A8re-Sal%C3%A9e">Rivière-Salée</a> in <a href="Martinique">Martinique</a>. He was a youth player of his hometown club L'Éclair de Rivière-Salée before joining <a href="Paris%20Saint-Germain%20F.C.">Paris Saint-Germain</a> in 1973. <a href="Pierre%20Bajoc">Pierre Bajoc</a>, also playing for L'Éclair de Rivière-Salée at the time, joined PSG the same year. From 1973 to 1979, Nosibor would go on to make 42 appearances and score 6 goals across all competitions for the Parisian club. However, he did play for <a href="Angoul%C3%AAme-Soyaux%20Charente">Angoulême</a> on loan during the 1977–78 season.
In 1979, Nosibor joined <a href="Stade%20Rennais%20F.C.">Rennes</a>, the club at which he would make the most appearances during his career. He continued his career at <a href="AS%20Corbeil-Essonnes%20%28football%29">Corbeil-Essonnes</a>, <a href="Grenoble%20Foot%2038">Grenoble</a>, <a href="Le%20Puy%20Foot%2043%20Auvergne">Le Puy</a>, and <a href="AC%20Arles-Avignon">Arles</a> before retiring in 1989.
Managerial career.
After retiring, Nosibor became manager of <a href="Rapid%20de%20Menton">Menton</a>.
